en.awaitingCourtWillCheck: The court will check your applicaiton and pass it to the judge. If the judge agrees there's no reason why you shouldn't get your divorce, you'll be sent the time, date and court in which you decree nisi will be announced, You'll then be sent your decree nisi.
en.awaitingDecreeNisiGranted: After the decree nisi has been granted, you'll have to wait 6 weeks before you can finalise your divorce by getting a decree absolute.
en.awaiting4to6Months: It usually takes 4 to 6 months to get a divorce if your {{ case.divorceWho }} doesn't 'defend' it (doesn't try to prevent it).
en.awaitingCourtSends: The court sends the application to your {{ case.divorceWho }}
en.awaiting1WeekAfterSubmit: Up to 1 week after you submit it
en.awaitingAfterTheyGetIt: Up to 3 weeks after they get it
en.awaiting3to4WeeksAfterApply: 3 to 4 weeks after you apply for it
en.awaitingWaitToApplyForDecreeAbsolute: Wait to apply for decree absolute
en.awaiting6Weeks1Day: 6 weeks and 1 day after decree nisi is granted
en.awaiting2WorkingDays: 2 working days after applying for decree absolute
en.awaitingTimesCanVary: Times can vary depending on when and where you apply for a divorce, and how long it takes your {{ case.divorceWho }} to respond.
